page.title: 14LARKHALL MEDIA
page.content: WE DESCOVERD THAT ALL THE PEOPLE WE INTERVEIWED WATCHED T.V. AND LISTENED TO THE RADIO AN AVERAGE OF 22 HOURS A WEEK. THE MOST POPULAR PROGRAMMES ON T.V. WERE SOAP OPERAS SUCH AS DALLAS AND DYNASTY.THE MOST POPULAR RADIO STATION WAS THE RADIO 1 SERVICE OF THE BBC WHICH PLAYS 'POP' MUSIC ALMOST CONTINNOUSLY THEN IT WAS RADIO CLYDE,A PRIVATE LOCAL STATION WHICH COMBINES 'POP' MUSIC WITH NEWS AND 2 FEATURE PROGRAMMES.THEN COMES RADIO 2 PLAYING MUSIC FOR MORE MIDDLE AGED TASTES AND LASTLY COMES RADIO SCOTLAND WHICH SPECIALISES IN SCOTISH NEWS AND FEATURES
